Data Loading

This section documents functions related to data loading.

Load Process Report

data_loading.load_process_report(path: str = '../../data/raw/process_report', id: int = 5822, column_list: list[str] = ['Time (s)', 'StepNumber', 'Upper Temperature (°C)', 'Lower Temperature (°C)', 'Z Position (mm)', 'Press Force (kN)', 'Lower Typ K Temperature (°C)', 'Lower Typ T Temperature (°C)', 'Upper Output Power (%)', 'Lower Output Power (%)', 'Upper Typ K Temperature (°C)', 'Upper Typ T Temperature (°C)'])

Loads and processes the contents of a process report Excel file into a pandas DataFrame.

Parameters

  • path (str) – The directory path where the Excel file is located. Defaults to “../../data/raw/process_report”.

  • id (int) – The specific ID of the process report to be loaded. Defaults to 5822.

  • column_list (list[str]) – The list of column names to assign to the DataFrame. Defaults to a predefined list of process report columns.

Returns

A dictionary containing the processed DataFrame, the captured ID from cell A1, and the type of report.

Return type

dict

Note

Only works on Excel files with the correct format of a standard process report.

Example Usage:

result = load_process_report(path="path/to/process_report", id=5822)
print(result["Dataframe"])
print("Captured ID:", result["Captured_ID"])
print("Report Type:", result["Type"])

Load Experiment Design

data_loading.load_experiment_design(path: str = '../../data/interim/design_of_experiment.txt', sheet: str = 'Agg')

Loads the experiment data from a file into a pandas DataFrame. This function supports both Excel files (.xls, .xlsx) and text files (.txt). For Excel files, data is loaded from the specified sheet. For text files, data is assumed to be comma-separated. It removes the columns “Dia_Des [mm]”, “Dia_Act [mm]”, and “CT_Des [mm]” from the resulting DataFrame.

Parameters

  • path (str) – The file path to the file containing the experiment data. The default path points to a text file, but it can be changed to point to an Excel file as needed.

  • sheet (str) – The name of the sheet within the Excel file from which to load the data. This parameter is ignored for text files. Defaults to “Agg”.

Returns

A DataFrame containing the data from the specified file, with the columns “Dia_Des [mm]”, “Dia_Act [mm]”, and “CT_Des [mm]” removed. The resulting DataFrame may contain columns such as ID, T1, P1, and CT_Act [mm], depending on the file content.

Return type

pd.DataFrame

Examples

# For Excel files
>>> df = load_experiment_design(path="path/to/your/file.xlsx", sheet="YourSheetName")
>>> print(df.head())

# For text files
>>> df = load_experiment_design(path="path/to/your/file.txt")
>>> print(df.head())

Note

Ensure that pandas is installed in your environment as this function depends on it. For text files, the delimiter is assumed to be a comma. Adjust the reading function accordingly if your text file uses a different delimiter.
